text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-SubstanceSourceMaterial

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*Extension(4.0.1)Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This set of data elements shall be used to define polymer substances isolated from biological matrices. Taxonomic and anatomical origins shall be described using a controlled vocabulary as required. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:sourceMaterialClass 0..1ExtensionGeneral high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialClass"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptGeneral high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material
extension:sourceMaterialType 0..1ExtensionThe type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialType"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent
extension:sourceMaterialState 0..1ExtensionThe state of the source material when extracted
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.sourceMaterialState"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe state of the source material when extracted

url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.organismId"
value[x] 0..1IdentifierThe unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified
extension:organismName 0..1ExtensionThe organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.organismName"
value[x] 0..1stringThe organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy
extension:parentSubstanceId 0..*ExtensionThe parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.parentSubstanceId"
value[x] 0..1IdentifierThe parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant)
extension:parentSubstanceName 0..*ExtensionThe parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.parentSubstanceName"
value[x] 0..1stringThe parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation
extension:countryOfOrigin 0..*ExtensionThe country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For Plasma-derived substances the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.countryOfOrigin"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For Plasma-derived substances the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate
extension:geographicalLocation 0..*ExtensionThe place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.geographicalLocation"
value[x] 0..1stringThe place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat
extension:developmentStage 0..1ExtensionStage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.developmentStage"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptStage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum)
extension:fractionDescription 0..*ExtensionMany complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels

value[x] 0..1stringThis element is capturing information about the fraction of a plant part, or human plasma for fractionation

extension:organism 0..1ExtensionThis subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf

url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceSourceMaterial.organism.intraspecificType"

value[x] 0..1stringThe intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention

name: ExtensionSubstanceSourceMaterial
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.SubstanceSourceMaterial` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `SubstanceSourceMaterial` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `SubstanceSourceMaterial` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`SubstanceSourceMaterial` 0..* `SubstanceSourceMaterial`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
* R5 `SubstanceSourceMaterial` 0..* `SubstanceSourceMaterial`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `SubstanceSourceMaterial` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `SubstanceSourceMaterial` is not mapped.

element.short: Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This set of data elements shall be used to define polymer substances isolated from biological matrices. Taxonomic and anatomical origins shall be described using a controlled vocabulary as required. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex
element.definition: Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This set of data elements shall be used to define polymer substances isolated from biological matrices. Taxonomic and anatomical origins shall be described using a controlled vocabulary as required. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex.

element.short: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels
